comments.body:
I like the size of the gravel pits.  It makes it easy to gather gravel for making concrete.  The best other option is to find a gravelly extreme hills biome or to mine the bottom of the ocean.

I also play Bedrock edition, so we're comparing apples to apples.
I agree with claygoddessdari's point, but on bedrock gravel pits still seem to be much larger, also not everyone uses concrete that much.

I agree with TheIronSniper1. The generation of gravel should probably be a happy middle from where it used to be. Since the introduction of concrete I've found myself mining it. From my experience the clusters seem a bit tall.

I wonder if this ought to be in the #MinecraftParity section. Going from mining in Java to mining in Bedrock is "Astonishing" with respect to gravel. If gravel is actually needed as a resource, that's what gravel pits and mounds are for in Extreme Hill biomes. I get these are needed as "mining hazards", but enough is enough!

I believe that gravel pits should be reduced by 30% or 40% because there is already an abundance of gravel in the nether, ocean and extreme hills biome. I understand that it is supposed to add some danger but when it rarely kills so all it does is slow down the pace of the game and makes caving not fun.
maybe just use the red circle particle as the texture as well? maybe using the plant cross model so its easier to see them behind each other?
good idea

I do love storage drawers.  They have a very vanilla feel compared to other storage mods, too.

I think that the devs should take the essential idea of storage drawers (containers that can only store one type of item, can be upgraded to hold more, and can be connected together to make putting stuff back easier) and put their own twist on it.

For example, I think they should be a little harder to make, and therefore later in game than the mod recipes.  No matter what, I think the recipe should be a little more difficult than chests with more wood, since I see them as a more advanced form of storage.  Including redstone somewhere in the recipe might be appropriate, especially if the ability to communicate with a central controller is kept.

If you want to do a craft use diamond like this

aba

bcb

aba

A=diamond

B=wood

C=chest
I think a Genie Bottle or a Wish Bottle would fit better in Minecraft
The bottles could have 3 uses or there could be 3 of these bottles in a brewing stand

I wish this could come true, especially since there is a new Copper Age Game Drop. but I think Mojang already finished on the ideas for the update.

I loved the copper horns when there were added to beta and preview. and now with all the copper stuff being added it feels silly not to re-add this feature.
This is a good idea I was thinking the same think we need another use for the Sniffer.
Those colours where nice
sculpte everything

I agree! especially with the horse/Mounts of Mayhem update, adding netherite horse armor would be on par! and the trims to armor would be really cool too! Imagine having enchanted silence-trimmed netherite armor, saddling your matching-trimmed horse, wielding a netherite spear, and charging off into battle!

This is amazing ideas only thing I would add is deflection hit projectiles farther away when they hit the shield instead of being Thorne's. For example have a arrow be deflection 10 blocks with level one. So that you can send the arrow back at the shooter. All these enchantments will greatly enhance pvp.

I like this idea, I would also suggest to add blast protection (I - III) for shields to protect players for creepers or tnt. I would also like to acknowledge the other comment for this thread, however, I would believe the rebound ability would make more sense for the arrow deflection rather than changing the thorns idea.
I have changed the post as you suggested. It's a good idea
i like it

this could be pretty useful for traveling to far away locations and stuff, but it would be prevented from being too lit by the fact that it needs tracks and fuel üëç

Minecraft train

I love I had a thought of making a video or trying to make one about a whole update Minecraft should do and it be called the color update and in the mob vote the moobloom would be in it and your idea which I also had would be in it and carpets could be on stairs and saddles and wood, stairs and other stuff could be dyable too
"Like gold but slower"

I think for now adding armor and tools that are weaker than those we already have wouldn't be a great idea, since most of the people don't even use leather/wood and gold, plus the stone tools get discarded very quickly as iron is so easy to find. copper tools would be another gold-like ore, no one uses their armor and tools because iron is just better and they are very similar in terms of rarity.
how about slightly better protection and a bit less attack damage than iron.

NOOOOOOO !!!!!!!
I think it's a bad idea...
This is a good idea, but it needs a different name
In turn, freezing would reduce the attack speed.
In that case, the Strays should have those bows, without the slow arrows.

Arrowcicles, Hailstorm, blizzard, etc

The ability to aoe freeze water 3x3 single layer as well as any unfortunate sucker in it.
I've always called the ice effect frostbite.
Like the debug stick ?
yes this should really be a feature in the game, would be especially useful to be able to rotate redstone components in tight spots
Maybe flint instead of iron so it can be a very early game tool

An the drawback(s) is/are‚Ä¶
If it‚Äôs that cheap is has to have lower quality.
Maybe its negative is doing less damage than a trident.
Maybe can include the Loyalty Enchantment to it!
Inventory in the game holds a lot of items. Inventory management is a full part of the gameplay.
This will unfortunately make survival less fun, but I can see this being implemented in creative for more complicated builds.
Yeah! Mojang shouldn‚Äôt just remove fireflies because frogs can‚Äôt eat them, just make them ambient!

Honestly I wouldn't be surprised if something like the Fireflies already had plenty of development. The only reason they were scrapped was because some community members brought up that some fireflies were poisonous. They could easily cut out interactions between the firefly and frog mobs, but Mojang said they wouldn't work on Fireflies for the next couple updates. We've seen this happen to the Illusioner, Zombie Horse, Fletching Table, etc. How many other features are they gonna put off?? I can't imagine what "priorities" would demand so much empty promises for an update.
To be honest, fireflies are pointless. It's just 2 pixels and they don't do anything.
Well, Piglin kids never grow up. But they should add it to other mobs with a name tag named ‚Äútoddler‚Äù.

yeh, but maby not an entirely new item maby just a specific name on the name tag that can keep mobs baby forever. -

My name misstak dat i chag the name
This would be amazing!
I agree, this would be such a nice addition!
will hardcore platers go to the deep dark for that ? it is op, but wardens are strong.

but, what if a player already has Prot/Fire Prot/ Projectile Prot/Blast Prot 4? First, how is it going to be applied...maybe instead of Enchantments, just potion effect, such as resistance instead of Prot, fire resistance instead of Fire Prot, slow falling instead of Feather Falling, Haste instead of Efficiency...that would be much easier to implement and more coherent

I like the idea of having a totem made from echo shards because they both deal with death and it would be an amazing use but I think your suggestion for what that would look like is a little bit too weak to justify the cost. 

 

my idea would be to make it so when its activated a big boom attack similar to the wardens pushed enemies away and inflicted weakness 2 and slowness 5 for 10 seconds. it clears enemies away from you, reduces their damage while doing all the other things a regular totem does. also make it cost 1 echo shard and have it crafted in the smithing table
A totem that gives you effects would be neat but I don't think it should be enchanting your tools
sick
The Echo Totem doesn't sound the coolest, however maybe the recovery compass could lead the player to their last death point if the die with one in hand.

I had a similar idea recently! Though it used goat horns to reproduce the echo shard's sound.

Essentially it would be nice if they could store sound, and then have the goat horn be used to reproduce it. I wonder if that's why my post got removed? Not sure.

Anyways, yeah. Them storing sound would seemingly fit with the fact that they're "echo" shards - and imagine how many things could be done if any minecraft sound effect could be stored by them!
These are very cool but maybe we could add the same thing for normal goat horn.
Then it would be moths not fireflies.
We should have a better use for fireflies. Maybe you could catch them and use them as bait?
I like this idea, it demonstrates real like facts that fireflies send messages through light
Good idea! This could really make fireflies being used for ambiance easy!

I like this idea, and you can place the backpack item into your offhand slot, which then will appear on your characters back, and having the item in the offhand slot will allow for one more inventory row of slots for early game, whenever you open ur inventory

Before anyone is like "oh but we have shulkers" I'm a peaceful mode player, mostly cuz i like building in survival, and I'd love to have something i can put building material in as i adventure without needing a mod, everything mod I've found doesn't work for me and it exhausting.
That's why they tried the bundle concept instead.
